entry.title: SHOWERS BEGIN LATE WEDNESDAY WITH MOUNTAIN SNOW
entry.summary: November 11, 2025 4:00 a.m. Southern Oregon will see showers beginning late Wednesday with mountain snow possible. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said active weather will return with breezy conditions starting late Thursday. Snow levels will drop to as low as 4,000 feet on Thursday, rising to 5,000 feet by Friday afternoon....

entry.summary: November 11, 2025 3:20 a.m. The Roseburg High School Marching Ensemble ended its 2025 competitive season with a record-setting performance at the Northwest Association for Performing Arts Championships on November 1st. entry.summary: November 11, 2025 3:05 a.m. On Monday, Oregon Governor Tina Kotek announced that she signed House Bill 3991 into law. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.10.25
entry.summary: YMCA of Douglas County CEO Stephen Stanfield talks about their annual fund raising campaign and how the community can help. He also talks about the history of the YMCA both internationally and here in Roseburg.

entry.summary: Dr. Jason Heald of Umpqua Community College talks about their Veterans Day Concert on Tuesday and other upcoming UCC music events.

entry.title: Douglas High School Mural Project Paused Amid Unresolved Financial Questions
entry.summary: The Douglas High School mural project, started by David Van Dermark and fellow alumni, is on pause as organizers, including his son Joseph Ziegler, work to clarify financial details and complete the project with transparency and community pride.

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY VETERANS DAY PARADE IS TUESDAY
entry.summary: November 20, 2025 3:30 a.m. Douglas County’s Veterans Day Parade is Tuesday. entry.title: Walkout Planned at Winston Middle School to Address Bullying Concerns
entry.summary: A student-led walkout is planned Monday at Winston Middle School to raise awareness about bullying and safety concerns. Organized by 13-year-old Ashton, the event has gained attention from parents and community members online.

entry.title: UCAN will operate Roseburg Warming Center for third year
entry.summary: As temperatures drop, staff with United Community Action Network (UCAN) are preparing to operate the Roseburg Warming Center again this winter for the third consecutive year.

entry.title: PacifiCorp Credit Downgrade Raises Bankruptcy Concerns Amid Wildfire Lawsuits
entry.summary: PacifiCorp, the Oregon-based utility owned by Warren Buffett, warns of a potential liquidity crisis amid lawsuits over the 2020 wildfires. Facing billions in damages and credit downgrades, the company says ongoing litigation threatens its long-term operations.

entry.title: Canyonville ODOT Station Retains Funding, Continues Key Role in Highway Safety
entry.summary: The Canyonville ODOT station will remain fully staffed after avoiding budget cuts. The small crew plays a vital role in keeping I-5 and nearby highways safe, responding quickly to winter storms, emergencies, and incidents across southern Douglas County.

entry.title: Roseburg library adds digital newspapers
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library now offers access to thousands of digital newspapers through NewsBank.

entry.title: Oakland murder case heats up
entry.summary: Editors note: This article references a brutal murder, and contains language and information that may not be appropriate for some readers, especially children.

entry.title: Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopens after rehabilitation project
entry.summary: The Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopened Tuesday night after being closed to vehicle traffic for several months. The bridge, spanning the South Umpqua River, closed in February for a major rehabilitation project.

entry.title: Columbia Bank, UCAN team up for November donation barrels
entry.summary: Senior Vice President at Columbia Bank David Adamson said Thursday that Columbia Bank is committed to helping people.

entry.title: Healing through rafting: Paul Eckel documents journey post service
entry.summary: Paul Eckel said his time in the U.S. Army and Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) turned him into a tested combatant, but his time in the North Umpqua River has healed him immensely.

entry.title: Communicating around the waters: Paul Romero reflects on his Navy service
entry.summary: Paul Romero said he originally joined the U.S. Navy to pay off college with a GI bill.
